content: Was Abraham Lincoln taller than the average man during his time?

Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was indeed taller than the average man of his time. He stood at 6 feet 4 inches (193 cm) tall, which was notably taller compared to the average height of American men in the mid-19th century, which was around 5 feet 7 inches (170 cm). His height was often remarked upon and was one of his most distinctive physical characteristics.
